intro: Lithocarpus lemeeanus subsp. langbianensis, commonly known as the Langbian stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, dense wood and evergreen foliage. It is native to Southeast Asia, specifically found in Vietnam and southern China. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soils. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a thick, woody shell. This subspecies is valued for its timber and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
